newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Dow, weak dollar seen pulling down Budapest shrs.
newsitem.headline: Dow, weak dollar seen pulling down Budapest shrs.

text.p: The Budapest Stock Exchange (BSE) is expected to trade lower on Thursday, weighed down by the Dow's nearly two percent fall and the substantial weakening of the U.S. currency.
"The dollar weakened, the Dow Jones fell, so I expect the Hungarian share market to ease," said Tamas Revesz of Wintrust.
Both Revesz and another trader expected Wednesday's strongest gainer, oil company MOL, to retreat after a major order was satisfied and due to profit-taking.

"I expect MOL to weaken, I think a major client order pushed it up yesterday and (when it was met) MOL closed below the day's peak," another trader said. "I don't expect substantial changes for the rest of the market."
On Wednesday the BUX index closed at 5,965.43 points, up 101.00.
